IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: CARING FOR EVERY GENERATION THROUGH EXCEPTIONAL SERVICES BY LEADING PHYSICIANS AND A COMPASSIONATE HEALTHCARE TEAM.
IRS990.MissionDescription: TO SUPPORT CITIZENS MEMORIAL HOSPITAL DISTRICT AND LOCAL RURAL COMMUNITIES. FOR ADDITIONAL INFORMATION, SEE SCHEDULE O.
IRS990.Description: PROVIDE LONG TERM CARE SERVICES TO MEDICAID RECIPIENTS (APPROXIMATELY 82,000 RESIDENT DAYS) IN SKILLED FACILITIES. FOR MORE INFORMATION, SEE SCHEDULE O.

Activity2.Description: PROVIDE RESIDENTIAL CARE SERVICES FOR THE ELDERLY TO APPROXIMATELY 58 RESIDENTS PER DAY. FOR MORE INFORMATION, SEE SCHEDULE O.

Activity3.Description: PROVIDE HOME CHORE SERVICES TO PEOPLE LIVING AT HOME BUT UNABLE TO COMPLETELY CARE FOR THEMSELVES. THROUGH HOMEMAKER PLUS, 46,500 SERVICE UNITS WERE PROVIDED THROUGH LIGHT HOUSEKEEPING, LAUNDRY, SHOPPING AND RESPITE CARE SERVICES. FOR MORE INFORMATION, SEE SCHEDULE O.

Form990ScheduleCPartIV.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION PAYS ANNUAL DUES TO THE MISSOURI HEALTH CARE ASSOCIATION (MHCA) AND THE AMERICAN HEALTH CARE ASSOCIATION (AHCA). A PORTION OF THESE DUES ARE ALLOCABLE TO LOBBYING: $860 MHCA AND $711 AHCA.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: THE FOUNDATION WAS THE TRUSTEE OF $40,083 AND $48,578, RESPECTIVELY, AT MAY 31, 2010 AND 2009, IN FUNDS RECEIVED ON BEHALF OF VARIOUS RESIDENTS. THE FOUNDATION HAS FIDUCIARY RESPONSIBILITY FOR THE ADMINISTRATION OF THE BANK ACCOUNTS AND THE DISTRIBUTION OF THE FUNDS TO RESIDENTS.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: FORM 990, SCHEDULE D, PART X, LINE 2
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION ADOPTED THE PROVISIONS OF FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING STANDARDS BOARD (FASB) INTERPRETATION NO. 48, ACCOUNTING FOR UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES. BECAUSE NO MATERIAL UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS WERE IDENTIFIED, A DISCLOSURE WAS NOT INCLUDED IN THE FOOTNOTES TO THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: FORM 990, SCHEDULE D, PART XIII, LINE 4B

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: CITIZENS MEMORIAL HEALTH CARE FOUNDATION HAS A MEDICAL EXCELLENCE SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE MADE UP OF BOARD MEMBERS, EMPLOYEES AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS. APPLICATIONS FOR THE SCHOLARSHIP MUST BE SUBMITTED EACH YEAR BY MARCH 1. THE COMMITTEE DETERMINES WHO THE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO. IF THE AWARDED DOES NOT ENROLL IN A MEDICAL RELATED CLASS TIMELY, THE SCHOLARSHIP IS WITHDRAWN. MANY OF THE PAYMENTS ARE MADE DIRECTLY TO THE SCHOOL AND NOT THE INDIVIDUAL.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: IN FY 2010, THE FOUNDATION'S BOARD APPROVED TO PAY OUT BONUSES AT 10% OF NET INCOME. THE BONUS IS ALLOCATED TO ALL MANAGEMENT AND STAFF, AND MR. BABB'S ALLOCATION OF THIS BONUS IS SHOWN ON SCHEDULE J, PART II, COLUMN B(II).

INDUSTRIAL DVLP AUTHORITY OF DALLAS COUNTY

INDUSTRIAL DVLP AUTHORITY OF THE CITY OF BOLIVAR

GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE TOTAL NUMBER OF VOLUNTEERS INCLUDES NON-COMPENSATED MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS ALONG WITH OTHER AUXILIARY VOLUNTEERS WHO ASSIST WITH A VARIETY OF OPPORTUNITIES AT THE FOUNDATION'S FACILITIES. ORGANIZATION MISSION FORM 990, PART III, QUESTION 1 TO SUPPORT CMH HOSPITAL DISTRICT THROUGH LONG TERM CARE SERVICES SUCH AS SKILLED NURSING FACILITIES, RESIDENTIAL CARE FACILITIES AND INDEPENDENT LIVING APARTMENTS, AND TO PROVIDE SERVICES TO THE LOCAL RURAL COMMUNITIES SUCH AS MEDICAL EQUIPMENT AND SUPPLIES, HEALTH TRANSPORTATION AND HOMEMAKER CHORE SERVICES.

WE OFFER CARE AT EVERY STAGE OF LIFE BY PROVIDING HOME CARE, INDEPENDENT LIVING, RESIDENTIAL CARE AND SKILLED NURSING (LONG TERM CARE) FACILITIES. ALL FACILITIES OFFER RESIDENT AND FAMILY SERVICES INCLUDING SOCIAL SERVICES; DAILY ACTIVITIES AND MONTHLY OUTINGS; BEAUTY AND BARBER SERVICES; VISITS FROM COMMUNITY AND SCHOOL ORGANIZATIONS; AND LAUNDRY, CHURCH AND PHARMACY SERVICES. MONTHLY FAMILY SUPPORT GROUPS AND RESIDENT CARE PLANNING MEETINGS ASSIST FAMILY MEMBERS WITH EDUCATION AND RESOURCES TO ENHANCE THE QUALITY OF TIME SHARED WITH LOVED ONE. IN ADDITION, IF PATIENTS NEED A LITTLE EXTRA HELP, HOMEMAKER PLUS CAN HELP THEM REMAIN INDEPENDENT IN THEIR HOME. OUR SERVICES ARE PROVIDED ON A NONDISCRIMINATORY BASIS AND CAN BENEFIT EVERYONE, FROM THE ELDERLY AND PHYSICALLY CHALLENGED TO THE HEALTHY FAMILY ON THE GO. A CARING INDIVIDUAL WILL VISIT THE HOME AND ASSIST PATIENTS ON A LONG-TERM OR ONE-TIME BASIS WITH PERSONAL CARE SERVICES, HOUSEKEEPING CHORES, MEAL PLANNING, GROCERY SHOPPING AND A HOST OF OTHER IMPORTANT SERVICES. OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES FORM 990, PART III, QUESTION 4D OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES INCLUDE ACTIVITIES WHICH PROMOTE THE ORGANIZATION'S EXEMPT PURPOSE. BOARD MEMBER BUSINESS RELATIONSHIP FORM 990, PART VI, QUESTION 2 BOARD MEMBERS BRAD GREGORY AND DAVE STRADER HAVE A BUSINESS RELATIONSHIP. 990 REVIEW PROCESS FORM 990, PART VI, QUESTION 11A PRIOR TO FILING, A DRAFT OF THE 990 WILL BE REVIEWED BY TOP MANAGEMENT. A FINAL DRAFT WILL BE DISCUSSED AT A MEETING OF THE FULL BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

ANNUALLY, DURING THE MARCH BOARD OF DIRECTOR'S MEETING, THE OFFICERS AND DIRECTORS DISCLOSE ALL KNOWN CONFLICTS OF INTEREST. ANY BOARD MEMBER WITH A CONFLICT OF INTEREST ABSTAINS FROM VOTING ON ANY MATTER RELATED TO THAT CONFLICT. IN ADDITION, ALL CORPORATE OFFICERS AND KEY EMPLOYEES ARE ANNUALLY REQUIRED TO REPORT POTENTIAL CONFLICTS OF INTEREST.

THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS OF CITIZENS MEMORIAL HOSPITAL DISTRICT ESTABLISHES THE COMPENSATION FOR THE CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER/EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR BASED UPON COMPENSATION FOR SIMILAR POSITIONS IN THE HEALTHCARE INDUSTRY. A WRITTEN EMPLOYMENT AGREEMENT DETAILS THE SALARY AND BENEFITS FOR THE CEO/EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR. CITIZENS MEMORIAL HEALTH CARE FOUNDATION PAYS A PERCENTAGE OF THE TOTAL BASED UPON THE ESTIMATED PERCENTAGE OF TIME SPLIT BETWEEN THE TWO ORGANIZATIONS. THIS PERCENTAGE IS NOT ANNUALLY REVIEWED OR APPROVED BY THE CITIZENS MEMORIAL HOSPITAL DISTRICT BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

MANY ORGANIZATION POLICIES ARE MADE AVAILABLE TO EMPLOYEES ON THE COMPANY INTRANET, FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE MADE AVAILABLE UPON WRITTEN REQUEST TO ALL BONDHOLDERS FOR A LEGITIMATE BUSINESS PURPOSE, AND THE AUDIT REPORT IS MADE AVAILABLE TO ALL LENDERS. IN GENERAL, DOCUMENTS ARE NOT MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC BY ANY OTHER MEANS.
